intro: Vitex iringensis, commonly known as the Irian Island vitex, is a flowering plant native to Indonesia. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, violet-blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in warmer regions.
